Artificial feeding in emergencies 
Any support of artificial feeding in an emergency should be based on a needs assessment by 
skilled technical staff, including a risk analysis. This applies both in the context of HIV where 
replacement feeding may have been established pre-crisis or in any population where infants may 
be artificially fed. Interventions that support artificial feeding should meet key criteria on targeting,
